verses.verse: Oh <S%H3863><s%> that thou wouldest <S%H7167>rend<s%> the <S%H8064>heavens<s%>, that thou wouldest come <S%H3381>down<s%>, that the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> might <S%H2151>quake<s%> at thy <S%H6440>presence<s%>,

as when <S%H784>fire<s%> <S%H6919>kindleth<s%> the <S%H2003>brushwood<s%>, and the <S%H784>fire<s%> causeth the <S%H4325>waters<s%> to <S%H1158>boil<s%>; to make thy <S%H8034>name<s%> <S%H3045>known<s%> to thine <S%H6862>adversaries<s%>, that the <S%H1471>nations<s%> may <S%H7264>tremble<s%> at thy <S%H6440>presence<s%>!

When thou <S%H6213>didst<s%> terrible <S%H3372>things<s%> which we <S%H6960>looked<s%> not <S%H3381>for<s%>, thou camest down, the <S%H2022>mountains<s%> <S%H2151>quaked<s%> at thy <S%H6440>presence<s%>.

For from of <S%H5769>old<s%> men have not <S%H8085>heard<s%>, nor perceived by the <S%H238>ear<s%>, neither hath the <S%H5869>eye<s%> <S%H7200>seen<s%> a <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H2108>besides<s%> <S%H6213>thee<s%>, who worketh for him that waiteth for <S%H2442>him<s%>.

Thou <S%H6293>meetest<s%> him that <S%H7797>rejoiceth<s%> and <S%H6213>worketh<s%> <S%H6664>righteousness<s%>, those that <S%H2142>remember<s%> thee in thy <S%H1870>ways<s%>: <S%H7107>behold<s%>, thou wast wroth, and we <S%H2398>sinned<s%>: in them have we been of long <S%H5769>time<s%>; and shall we be <S%H3467>saved<s%>?

For we are all become as one that is <S%H2931>unclean<s%>, and all our <S%H6666>righteousnesses<s%> are as a <S%H5708>polluted<s%> <S%H899>garment<s%>: and we all do <S%H5034>fade<s%> as a <S%H5929>leaf<s%>; and our <S%H5771>iniquities<s%>, like the <S%H7307>wind<s%>, take us <S%H5375>away<s%>.

And there is none that <S%H7121>calleth<s%> upon thy <S%H8034>name<s%>, that stirreth <S%H5782>up<s%> himself to take <S%H2388>hold<s%> of <S%H5641>thee<s%>; for thou hast hid thy <S%H6440>face<s%> from <S%H4127>us<s%>, and hast consumed us by <S%H3027>means<s%> of our <S%H5771>iniquities<s%>.
But <S%H3068>now<s%>, O Jehovah, thou art our <S%H1>Father<s%>; we are the <S%H2563>clay<s%>, and thou our <S%H3335>potter<s%>; and we all are the <S%H4639>work<s%> of thy <S%H3027>hand<s%>.

Be not <S%H7107>wroth<s%> very <S%H3966>sore<s%>, O <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>, neither <S%H2142>remember<s%> <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> for <S%H5703>ever<s%>: <S%H5027>behold<s%>, look, we beseech <S%H5971>thee<s%>, we are all thy people.
Thy <S%H6944>holy<s%> <S%H5892>cities<s%> are become a <S%H4057>wilderness<s%>, <S%H6726>Zion<s%> is become a <S%H4057>wilderness<s%>, <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> a <S%H8077>desolation<s%>.

Our <S%H6944>holy<s%> and our <S%H8597>beautiful<s%> <S%H1004>house<s%>, where our <S%H1>fathers<s%> <S%H1984>praised<s%> <S%H8316>thee<s%>, is burned with <S%H784>fire<s%>; and all our pleasant <S%H4261>places<s%> are laid <S%H2723>waste<s%>.
Wilt thou <S%H662>refrain<s%> thyself for these <S%H3068>things<s%>, O Jehovah? wilt thou hold thy <S%H2814>peace<s%>, and <S%H6031>afflict<s%> us very <S%H3966>sore<s%>?
